Title: Bandits kill one, abduct others in Katsina
Summary: Suspected bandits have killed one person and abducted an unspecified number of people . Incident occurred in Dantankari community, Dandume Local Government Area of Katsina State . Incident which occurred on Wednesday night also resulted in about half a dozen persons sustaining various injuries .

Title: Become a Key Distribution Partner with Nigeria’s Dairy Leader
Summary: We are looking for Partners 73 Territories across the country as Nigeria’s foremost dairy company and brand, our mission is clear and unwavering: To nourish Nigerians with quality dairy nutrition . To fulfil this mission today and in the future, we are looking to become a key distribution partner .

Title: Nafiu Bala resumes as ADC national chairman, rejects Mark’s leadership
Summary: Nafiu Bala resumes as ADC national chairman, rejects Mark’s leadership . Bala insists that he is the authentic leader of the party . The leadership tussle rocking the African Democratic Congress (ADC) has taken a new turn .

Title: INEC, IPAC commit to credible elections in Cross River
Summary: Inter-Party Advisory Council (IPAC), Cross River chapter, and the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) have pledged to enhance collaboration to ensure a robust and transparent electoral system . This was part of the outcome of a meeting held at the Cross River Chapter of INEC .

Title: Kidnappers of Katsina couple, daughter demand N600m ransom
Summary: Kidnappers of a 33-year-old man, Anas Ahmadu, his wife, and his daughter have demanded the sum of N600 million as ransom . A source close to the victims’ family members said the abductors were said to have called .

Title: Investigators probe motive behind Minneapolis shooting that killed two children, injured 17
Summary: Investigators are seeking to find out why a heavily armed shooter opened fire on children at a church service in Minneapolis on Wednesday . Two pupils were killed and 17 people were wounded in the latest violent tragedy to jolt the United States .

Title: Give us our entitlements, not loans, Taraba varsity ASUU tells FG
Summary: The Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU), Federal University Wukari (FUW) branch, has demanded the immediate payment of their accumulated entitlements, rejecting the Federal Government’s proposed loan scheme .

Title: Video: Libyan Police arrest 2 Nigerians for alleged robbery
Summary: The duo reportedly had reportedly been linked to a series of break-ins and thefts targeting commercial outlets in a bid to steal money . The duo had reportedly targeted commercial outlets .

Title: PSN Lagos raises alarm over soaring drug prices, salary disputes
Summary: Lagos State Chairman of the Pharmaceutical Society of Nigeria, PSN),Pharmarm. Oyekunle Babayemi, has warned that the Federal Government’s policies have failed to address the escalating prices of drugs in Nigeria, leaving millions of citizens stranded and at risk .

Title: 2027: I don’t belong to Atiku or Wike camps — Olawepo-Hashim
Summary: Presidential aspirant and PDP chieftain, Gbenga Olawepo-Hashim, has distanced himself from the two major factions in the opposition . He declared that he does not belong to either the Atiku Abubakar or Nyesom Wike camps . Speaking as a guest on Arise Television

Title: Dapo Abiodun hails Ogun monarch's leadership on birthday
Summary: Ogun State Governor, Prince Dapo Abiodun, has felicitated the Olota of Ota, Oba Adeyemi Obalanlege . He described his reign as one of peace, wisdom, and progress . The governor offered prayers for the monarch’s health and continued reign .

Title: JUST IN: Immigration hikes passport fees to N100,000, N200,000
Summary: The Nigeria Immigration Service has announced an upward review of the cost of obtaining the Nigerian Standard Passport . The new fees will apply only to applications made within Nigeria . Application fees for Nigerians in the diaspora remain unchanged at $150 .

Title: UBEC boss visits Nigeria’s oldest primary school, pledges inclusive education
Summary: Executive Secretary of the Universal Basic Education Commission, Aisha Garba, has reaffirmed the Federal Government’s commitment to expanding inclusive and equitable education across Nigeria, with a particular focus on riverine and historically significant communities . During the tour, Garba inspected key education projects, including the Smart School initiative in Olorunda Local Council

Title: Oil production rises to 1.7m barrels daily - NUPRC
Summary: Nigeria’s oil output has climbed to a new six-month high, averaging 1.71 million barrels of oil per day in July 2025, according to the Nigerian Upstream Petroleum Regulatory Commission . The increase marks a 9.9 per cent year-on-year surge, bringing the country closer to its budgetary and OPEC production targets

Title: Assault on VIO officials will not go unpunished – LASG
Summary: The Lagos State Ministry of Transportation has declared that the assault of its Vehicle Inspection Officers at the Mile 2 axis, while executing their lawful duties, would not go unpunished . The Commissioner for Transportation, Mr Oluwaseun Osiyemi, made the declaration in a statement on Thursday in Lagos .
